Questions.QuestionString: According to MME, can VNA grant concession?
Answers: No, must be submitted by CAAV.
Yes, because of approved by CAAV
VNA and all airlines shall not give concession

Questions.QuestionString: Which paper in Techlog control acceptable deferred defects (ADD) type C?
Answers: White page
Green page
Pink page

Questions.QuestionString: Where can you find a form which attaches in Techlog ?
Answers: Refer AMS & AMM appendix
Refer MME & LMM appendix
Refer MME Appendices And Forms

Questions.QuestionString: What does MME abbreviation for?
Answers: Maintenance Manual Exposition
Maintenance Management Exposition
Management Maintenance Exposition

Questions.QuestionString: Which of the following documents belongs to VNA’s documents?
Answers: Aircraft Maintenance Schedule
Maintenance Organization Exposistion
Aircraft Maintenance Manual

Questions.QuestionString: According to MME 3.64.5: The Definition Repetitive defect?
Answers: Warning of same intermittent fault (which is cleared by reset and test system operation) arising at least 03 times per 10 consecutive operating days, are detected by aircraft monitoring program or record in Technical Logbook.

Defect has the same nature of fault as defect previously happened which is confirmed and rectified strictly follow technical manual of manufacturer reoccur between 3 days (rectified date is not counted) or in 7 consecutive flights.

Warning of same intermittent fault (which is cleared by reset and test system operation) arising at least 03 times per 10 consecutive operating days, are detected by aircraft monitoring program or record in and Defect has the same nature of fault as defect previously happened which is confirmed and rectified strictly follow technical manual of manufacturer reoccur between 3 days (rectified date is not counted) or in 7 consecutive flights.

Questions.QuestionString: What requirements must VNA's MME documents meet?
Answers: Meets VAR and Aircraft Manufacturer requirements
Meets VAR and VAECO requirements
Meets Aircraft Manufacturer and AMO requirements

Questions.QuestionString: What statement is correct?
Answers: MEL/Airworthiness related acceptable deferred defects Type “B”: apply MEL/CDL
Defect does not affect aircraft airworthiness, safety/health of crew member, ground crew, passengers and can be deferred per MEL documnent
MEL/Airworthiness related acceptable deferred defects Type “B”: apply MEL/CDL and/or approved data (AMM, TSM, CMM, SRM…)

Questions.QuestionString: According to MME 3.61.6.1: MEL items will be applied to aircraft if at the airport ?
Answers: Lack of qualified maintenance personnel, tools, required spares and materials or sufficient down-time
MEL items will NOT be applied at Main Base
MEL items will be applied at all outstation only

Questions.QuestionString: CAAV delegations of concession approval: VNA assigns SQD as following:
Answers: Granting an extension of the applicable repair interval B, C for 50% duration as specified in the MEL
Granting an extension of the item interval as specified in AMM,TSM,SRM
One-Off approval for Authorized staff at out station.

Questions.QuestionString: Requirements for CRS staff perform maintenance tasks and release to service for VNA aircraft
Answers: To be authorized by contracted-AMO according to certificate A, B1/B2 or equivalent and trained about the related VNA procedures
CRS staff has CAAV licenses
CRS staff has EASA/FAA licenses

Questions.QuestionString: BLUE copy of Technical Log storage
Answers: shall be collected and stored at Outstation airport or Line Maintenance Center within 36 hours for a normal flight
shall be collected and stored at Outstation airport or Line Maintenance Center within 24 hours for a normal flight
pages shall be stored and managed at least 24 months from the last date of entry or or until aircraft is permanently transferred to next operator

Questions.QuestionString: The VNA's AMP document is approved by
Answers: EASA/FAA
Aircraft Manufactures
CAAV

Questions.QuestionString: At the same time, maximum concessions to extend MEL limit on the aircraft is
Handling with VNA Techlog books shall be perform in accordance with
Answers: MME of VNA
Contracted AMOs document
SOP of VAECO

Questions.QuestionString: Where LMM Procedure is applied?
Answers: All maintenance activities where VNA’s aircraft are operating
All line maintenance activities and at all airports where VNA’s aircraft are operating.
All base maintenance activities and at all airports where VNA’s aircraft are operating

Questions.QuestionString: The Preflight checks for VNA A/C should be performed
Answers: Not earlier than two (2) hours before the flight.
Not earlier than three (3) hours before the flight.
Not earlier than four (4) hours before the flight.

Questions.QuestionString: For weekly/line checks, what statement is true?
Answers: For ATR72: weekly check shall be carried out within every 08 days
For B787: weekly check shall be carried out within every 08 days
For A321 and A350: weekly check shall be carried out within every 08 days

Questions.QuestionString: Preflight/Transit check of aircraft is limited to:
Answers: Certifying staff who has achieved a required level of practical experience.
Certifying staff who has achieved a required level of practical experience and training relating to the specific tasks.
Any maintenance staff who has achieved a required level of practical experience and training relating to the specific tasks.

Questions.QuestionString: To raise 1 ADD, what should the authorized staff do?
Answers: Check if the failure/Malfunction is in the MEL Items,
Check the number of MEL CAT B with (O) Operational Procedures in Techlog book
Check if the failure/Malfunction is in the MEL Items, and Check the number of MEL CAT B with (O) Operational Procedures in Techlog book

Questions.QuestionString: For CDL item with no specify deferred period, what type of deferred defect you should raise?
Answers: Raise ADD type B with no time limit (ASAP)
Raise ADD type C with 09 months deferred period
Raise ADD type B with 06 months deferred period

Questions.QuestionString: When a repetitive defect occurs, certifying staff checks the MEL time remaining of previous related ADD. If MEL time limit is NOT remained,
Answers: Certifying staff grounds the aircraft and rectify defect if aircraft is outside of home base
Certifying staff inform MOC/MCC to request a concession with maximum 3 legs to home base if aircraft is outside of home base
Certifying staff inform MOC/MCC to request a concession with maximum 1 legs to home base if aircraft is outside of home base

Questions.QuestionString: Who is control the fueling process and on behalf of VNA he signs into fuel receipt ?
Answers: Fuel supplier’s staff
Representative VNA
The authorized staff

Questions.QuestionString: A final walk around check of the aircraft during Aircraft Preflight/Transit checks?
Answers: Carried out once all doors (except Door 1L) are closed to ensure the aircraft is fit for flight.
Particular attention must be paid to doors and panels normally opened during transit and especially the re-fuel cap.

Carried out once all doors (except Door 1L) are closed to ensure the aircraft is fit for flight and Particular attention must be paid to doors and panels normally opened during transit and especially the re-fuel cap.

Questions.QuestionString: Definition of Line Maintenance ?
Answers: Line maintenance is any maintenance that must be carried out to ensure that the aircraft is fit for the intended flight. It may include: Trouble shooting; Defect rectification; Component replacement with use of external test equipment if required.
Line maintenance is any maintenance that must be carried out to ensure that the aircraft is fit for the intended flight. It not include Trouble shooting and Defect rectification.
Line maintenance is any maintenance that must be carried out to ensure that the aircraft is fit for the intended flight. It may include Major repairs

Questions.QuestionString: How long the cabin defect log page will be removed by the authorized staff before departure ?
Answers: The cabin defect log page in green will be removed by the authorized staff before departure and keeping within 24 hours after that.
The cabin defect log page in yellow will be removed by the authorized staff before departure and keeping within 24 hours after that.
The cabin defect log page in yellow will be removed by the authorized staff before departure and keeping within 12 hours after that.

Questions.QuestionString: According to LMM 2.2: Form “Note to crews and engineer” ?
Answers: This form is used by CRS holders, AMO to pass all additional information and notices to flight crews and others maintenance staff working with the aircraft (such as inform of a repetitive defect…).
This form is used by CRS holders when carry out Line check
This form is used by Crews

Questions.QuestionString: Where can find the VNA - line maintenance checklist such as: pre-flight/transit, terminal/daily check in hardcopies?
Answers: On Technical Log folder.
On Technical Log folder and VAECO MOE.
On Technical Log folder and VNA - line maintenance manual.

Questions.QuestionString: In case the different fuel quantity between fuel vehicle and aircraft indicator is out of limit, what must technical Staffs do?
Answers: Verify the volume of fuel using manual magnetic stick or integrated refuel panel (IRP) and record in Tech Log.
Use aircraft fuel indicator to record in Tech Log.
Use vehicle fuel indicator to record in Tech Log.

Questions.QuestionString: For how long since discovering a defect or occurrence, the CAAV MOR form 14 a/b shall be sent to Technical & SQD of Vietnam Airlines
Answers: Within 72 hours
Within 48 hours
Within 96 hours

Questions.QuestionString: For De/Anti-ice decision, what statement is true?
Answers: The decision to de-ice the aircraft only made by ground engineer CRS
If the ground engineer requires de/anti-icing, the pilot in command can override this decision
If the pilot in command requires de/anti-icing, the ground engineer CRS must comply with this requirement

Questions.QuestionString: Definition of RII
Answers: RII inspection is imposed on those tasks that could result in a failure, malfunction, or defect that endangers the safe operation of the aircraft if the task is not completed properly or if you use improper parts or material.
RII inspection is imposed on those tasks that could result in a failure, malfunction, or defect that endangers the safe operation of the aircraft if you use improper parts or material.
RII inspection is imposed on those tasks that could result in a failure, malfunction, or defect that endangers the safe operation of the aircraft if the task is not completed properly.

Questions.QuestionString: Required Inspection Item (RII) tasks are performed
Answers: By qualified staff, then independently inspected and signed off by an authorized inspection staff.
By qualified staff, then independently inspected and signed off by a suitable authorized staff.
By qualified staff, then independently inspected and signed off by RII inspector whom accepted by Vietnam Airlines

Questions.QuestionString: WHAT IS PURPOSE OF EDTO PDSC?
Answers: The set of tasks to be performed prior to aircraft departure, including interior and exterior inspection tasks, maintenance records review, servicing tasks and other procedures applicable for certain significant systems such as engine or APU to ensure the airworthinessthe airworthiness

The set of tasks to be performed prior to aircraft arrival, including interior and exterior inspection tasks, maintenance records review, servicing tasks and other procedures applicable for certain significant systems such as engine or APU to ensure the airworthiness

The set of tasks to be performed after aircraft departure, including interior and exterior inspection tasks, maintenance records review, servicing tasks and other procedures applicable for certain significant systems such as engine or APU to ensure the airworthiness

Questions.QuestionString: Which flight route can be operation for the aircraft downgrade to Non EDTO?
Answers: Aircraft must be AOG
Non-EDTO Flight is a flight that A/C in operations within 120 minutes from an adequate airport
Non-EDTO Flight is a flight that A/C in operations within 60 minutes from an adequate airport

Questions.QuestionString: in MEL document, Which section can be determine flight specific requirements for EDTO flights for non-EDTO flights?
Answers: The Mel entries section
MEL document with the phrase "EXCEPT FOR EDTO" in the NOTES or EXCEPTION column of corresponding section
The general information section

Questions.QuestionString: Which document contained EDTO requirement sercive content during transit check?
Answers: The MEL document
The Preflight/transit check list
The LMM

Questions.QuestionString: In case of an engine in-flight shutdown, which verification procedure need to recover the EDTO capacity?
Answers: Ground verification
In-Flight Verification
No need

Questions.QuestionString: Following LMM 2.9 in case of install the non- EDTO part or part with restrictions on the aircraft and release the aircraft to service after completing the followings:
Answers: Check that the part P/N is listed in the relevant IPC
Check with the VAECO MCC for the part status

Against the entry of faulty part in the DEFECT column, add a phrase “A/C DOWNGRADED TO NON-EDTO, DUE TO NON-EDTO PART (or PART WITH RESTRICTIONS) FITTED” into the ACTION TAKEN column of the Aircraft Technical Log after statement about defect rectification. Raise an ADD “B” type (deadline note: “UNTIL EDTO PART REFITTED”) and open a NTC to inform flight crews that the aircraft is downgraded to NON- EDTO; circle YES in the “OPS LIMIT” box in the ADD “B” type list (pink color).vBrief Flight Crew of any possible performance limitations.vAdvise VAECO MCC of the situation by a standard departure telex.

Questions.QuestionString: What is definition of RII?
Answers: RII is an item of maintenance that, if performed properly or if proper parts or materials utilized, it could result in a failure, malfunction, or defect, endangering the safe operation of the aircraft

RII is an item of maintenance that, if not performed properly or if proper parts or materials utilized, it could result in a failure, malfunction, or defect, endangering the safe operation of the aircraft

RII is an item of maintenance that, if not performed properly or if improper parts or materials utilized, it could result in a failure, malfunction, or defect, endangering the safe operation of the aircraft

Questions.QuestionString: What is the responsibility of the RII inspector?
Answers: RII Inspector performs RII inspection on VNA aircraft
RII Inspector performs RII inspection on all aircraft.
RII Inspector performs RII inspection on A321 aircraft

Questions.QuestionString: What are the requirements for RII inspector?
Answers: Must be trained, qualified and authorized by VNA SQD
Must be trained, qualified and authorized by VAECO SQD
Must be trained, qualified and authorized by customer SQD

Questions.QuestionString: How is RII work certified?
Answers: The RII work shall contain two certifications: Certification from a certifying staff who performed the work and Certification from a RII authorized staff who performed the second inspection (referred as inspector)

The RII work shall contain two certifications: Certification from a certifying staff who performed the first inspection of the work (referred as Inspector1) and Certification from an authorized staff who performed the second inspection (referred as inspector2)

The RII work shall contain two certifications: Certification from a certifying staff who performed the first inspection of the work (referred as Inspector1) and Certification from a RII authorized staff who performed the second inspection (referred as inspector2)

Questions.QuestionString: Where is List of Authorized RII Inspector stored?
Answers: SQD
HRD
TED

Questions.QuestionString: In cases where the work has been rejected by an RII inspector due to unsatisfactory,
Answers: The rework has been completed by RII authorized staff who performed the second inspection (referred as inspector2).
The rework has been completed by certifying staff who performed the first inspection of the work (referred as Inspector1)
A re-inspection is required after the rework has been completed (buy-back procedure)

Questions.QuestionString: De-icing definition:
Answers: "Is a procedure to remove the frost, ice, snow or slush from the aircraft by applying hot water or a hot mixture of water and de/anti-icing fluid"
"Is a procedure to ensure the ice, snow and/or frost does not collect and become attached to the aircraft surface by applying antiicing fluid or mixture of anti-icing fluid and water"
"Is a procedure to ensure the ice, snow and/or frost does not collect and become attached to the aircraft surface by applying hot water"

Questions.QuestionString: The holdover time starts with
Answers: Initial application of the Type I (for one-step operation)
"The application of the Type II of Type IV anti-icing fluid (second stage of two-step operation)."
The application of hot water or hot mixture of de/anti-icing fluid and water to remove ice (first stage of two-step operation)

Questions.QuestionString: Who can make the decision to de-ice the aircraft
Answers: The ground engineer CRS only
The pilot in command only
"The ground engineer CRS or the pilot in command"

Questions.QuestionString: During de-icing operation:
Answers: The air conditioning system must be shut down
The air conditioning system can run if no one is aboard the aircraft
The air conditioning system can run even if there is passengers aboard the aircraft.

Questions.QuestionString: For maximum effectiveness and minimum consumption, the deicing solution must be heated to a temperature as high as possible but not to exceed
For anti-icing, concentration 75/25 will not be used at temperatures at or below
To sign and release aircraft to service with CAT II/III operation ability, a technical staff must:
Answers: Be a certificate holder (CRS) for the concerned aircraft type.
Maintenance staff are trained and certified about line maintenance manual, including CAT II/III maintenance procedure (LMM section 2.14).

Be a certificate holder (CRS) for the concerned aircraft type and Maintenance staff are trained and certified about line maintenance manual, including CAT II/III maintenance procedure (LMM section 2.14).

Questions.QuestionString: CAT II/III Maintenance Procedure is applied for:
Answers: A321, A350 aircraft in Vietnam Airlines fleet.
A321, A350 and B787 aircraft in Vietnam Airlines fleet.
ATR72. A321, A350 and B787 aircraft in Vietnam Airlines fleet.

Questions.QuestionString: If there’s an unsuccessful autoland performance regardless of any reasons reported by flight crew, the aircraft will be downgraded to:
Answers: CAT II capability until all defects (if any) are fixed and one autoland is successfully performed.
CAT III capability until all defects (if any) are fixed and one autoland is successfully performed.
CAT II capability until all defects (if any) are fixed or one autoland is successfully performed.

Questions.QuestionString: After a repair or an adjustment is made on the equipment, the CAT II/III revalidation of those equipment must be made by the corresponding AMM test:
Answers: "For Boeing aircraft: all required AMM testing tasks in trouble shooting and equipment restoration/installation task. equipment restoration/installation task."

For Airbus aircraft, perform: all required AMM testing tasks in trouble shooting and equipment restoration/installation task or AMM testing tasks required for CAT III operation which are mentioned in AMM documents.
For Airbus aircraft, perform: AMM testing tasks required for CAT III operation which are mentioned in AMM documents only.

Questions.QuestionString: Who shall upgrade aircraft to CAT II/III operation after rectifying all defects related to CAT II/III?
Answers: CAAV.
Contracted maintenance organization technical staff.
VNA.

Questions.QuestionString: Who will control CAT II/III status by B defect and C defect database?
Answers: MOC division (Technical Department) only.
VAECO (contracted maintenance organization) only.
"MOC division (Technical Department), together with VAECO (contracted maintenance organization). "

Questions.QuestionString: What advantages of PBN over classical Navigation system?
Answers: Reduction of Aviation congestion, Fuel consumption/Gas emission
Reduction of Aviation congestion, Fuel consumption/Gas emission, aircraft noise
Reduction of Aviation congestion

Questions.QuestionString: What are systems and components related to RNP10 operation in A/C B787
Answers: 2 FMF, 2 IRU/AHRU, 2 GPS with time limit group. 2FMF
2 FMF, 1 IRU/AHRU, 1 GPS or (DME and (VOR or VHF))
2 FMF, 2 IRU/AHRU, 2 GPS with time limit group. 2FMF and 2 IRU with no time limit group

Questions.QuestionString: In the PBN structure, how many kinds of approach?
How many type of navigation specific introduced by ICAO PBN manual?
Answers: 02: RNAV specification type and RNP specification type
01: RNAV specification type
01: RNP specification type

Questions.QuestionString: What are performance requirement needed for the proposed opreation of PBN?
Answers: Integrity, continuity, Availability
Accuracy, integrity, continuity, Availability
Accuracy, integrity, Availability

Questions.QuestionString: ANP stand for?
Answers: Actual Normal Performance
Actual Navigation Performance
Aircraft Navigation Performance

Questions.QuestionString: How many layers in non- RVSM Airspace:
What RVSM involves tight performance specifications is true?
Answers: Mean ASE plus 3 standard deviations less than 200 ft. (normal operating conditions)
Mean ASE plus 3 standard deviations less than 200 ft. (abnormal operating conditions)
Mean ASE plus 3 standard deviations more than 200 ft. (normal operating conditions)

Questions.QuestionString: RVSM Critical Component consit of?
Answers: Stactic & Pitot System
Stactic & Pitot System and Avionics & Altimetry System
Stactic & Pitot System and Avionics System

Questions.QuestionString: Training program, instructions and check lists RVSM designed for?
Answers: "Flight crew, Maintenance personnel, dispatchers and flight operations personnel"
"Flight crew, Maintenance personnel"
"Flight crew, Maintenance personnel, dispatchers"

Questions.QuestionString: RGCSP stand for?
Answers: Review of General Concept of Separation Panel
Review of General Concept of Separation Parameter
Review of General Component of Separation Panel

Questions.QuestionString: Which are requirements of REDUCED VERTICAL SEPARATION CERTIFICATION for VAECO CRS Staff?
Answers: To be trained about the related VNA’s procedures
To be authorized by contract AMO (VAECO)
To be authorized by contract AMO (VAECO) and To be trained about the related VNA’s procedures

Questions.QuestionString: What is RVSM?
Answers: Lateral separation minimum between aircrafts in airfield.
Vertical separation minimum between aircrafts in airfield.
RVSM belongs to GNSS-based which navigate all aircrafts in airfield for void collision.

Questions.QuestionString: RVSM is:
Answers: Reduced Vertical Speed Minimum
Reduced Vertical Separation Minimum
Reduced Vertical Separation Maximum

Questions.QuestionString: RVSM Critical Component include:
Answers: Static & Pitot System; Avionics and Altimetry System
Altimetry System; Static & Pitot System
Static & Pitot System; Electric and Altimetry System

Questions.QuestionString: In the past, aircraft flying between the surface and FL290 needed 1,000 feet of vertical separation, but anyone flying above FL290 needed 2,000 feet of separation. Why is that?
Answers: The accuracy of pressure altimeters decreases the higher you go, and at the time, altimeters weren't accurate not enough to guarantee adequate separation between converging traffic.
The accuracy of pressure altimeters decreases the lower you go, and at the time, altimeters weren't accurate enough to guarantee adequate separation between converging traffic.
The accuracy of pressure altimeters decreases the higher you go, and at the time, altimeters weren't accurate enough to guarantee adequate separation between converging traffic.

Questions.QuestionString: Who must attend the RVSM training, guidance, and checklist?
Answers: Flight crew, Maintenance personnel, dispatchers and flight operations personnel
Maintenance personnel, dispatchers and flight operations personnel
Flight attendant, Maintenance personnel, dispatchers and flight operations personnel

Questions.QuestionString: RVSM shall be applied in
Answers: Between FL 290 and FL 310
Between FL 290 and FL 410
Between FL 290 and FL 510

Questions.QuestionString: What are datalink functions ?
Answers: It sends automatic reports of the aircraft position to give aircraft surveillance data to the ATC ground station
It sends reports of the aircraft position to give aircraft surveillance data to the VNA ground station
It sends automatic reports of the aircraft position to give aircraft surveillance data to the FTC ground station

Questions.QuestionString: What technical staff action if malfuntion of Datalink is rased in techlog book?
Answers: Technical staff of contracted MRO will answer "Not Thank" in Action taken
Technical staff of contracted MRO will repair malfunction
Technical staff of contracted MRO will Apply MEL for Datalink INOP, Repair interval 3 day

Questions.QuestionString: What services does Data Link provide?
Answers: controller-pilot data link communications (CPDLC) and automatic dependent surveillance – contract (ADS-C)
automatic dependent surveillance – contract (ADS-C)
controller-pilot data link communications (CPDLC)

Questions.QuestionString: Choose the correct answer
Answers: Data Link providing direct controller-pilot communications (DCPC) in all airspace and ground
Data link allowing the flight crew to print messages
Data link allowing the flight crew to fly with autopilot function

Questions.QuestionString: Choose the correct answer
Answers: Data Link to reduce flight crew workload by supporting automatically transmitted reports when a specific event occurs
Data Link to reduce cabin crew workload by supporting automatically transmitted reports when a specific event occurs
Data Link to reduce technical staff workload by supporting automatically transmitted reports when a specific event occurs

Questions.QuestionString: When permitted to release the aircraft to service with the defect deferred for datalink operation, the Certifying Staff must do?
Answers: Add the phrase “NON - DATALINK” in the ACTION TAKEN, Raise an ADD “B” type and open a NTC, Advise VAECO MCC/MOC by a SITA (or email, FAX) about the situation
Add the phrase “NON - DATALINK” in the ACTION TAKEN, Brief Flight Crew of any possible performance limitations, Advise VAECO MCC/MOC by a SITA (or email, FAX) about the situation

Add the phrase “NON - DATALINK” in the ACTION TAKEN, Raise an ADD “B” type and open a NTC, Brief Flight Crew of any possible performance limitations, Advise VAECO MCC/MOC by a SITA (or email, FAX) about the situation
